```{r}

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

data <- read_csv(here::here("data/analysis_data/analysis_data.csv"))
```

# Introduction
This data was obtained from Open Data Toronto (@opendatatorotno) using R (@talia).

# Data {#sec-mydatasection}

In @fig-marriage, we see that most data is concentrated before 2020 (when the pandemic happened). There is a slight decrease in the years post-pandemic.

```{r}
#| label: fig-marriage
#| fig-cap: Scatterplot of Marriage Licences by Date
#| echo: false

data |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = marriage_licenses)) +
  geom_point()
```
